elements.title: Bernard Pitt (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a study of Anglo-Saxon literature begun by Bernard Pitt (pictured) in 1914 was completed by a colleague after Pitt was killed in the First World War?

elements.title: customaries (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the precise details in medieval customaries have allowed historians to reconstruct since-lost buildings?

elements.title: Rosalind Creasy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Rosalind Creasy wrote a landmark book on edible landscaping?

elements.title: June (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Neha Pendse, the lead actress of the Marathi film June, contributed some of her own money towards its production?

elements.title: John Barber White (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that American lumber businessman and politician John Barber White funded a scholarship at Williams College in memory of his son?

elements.title: squatters (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that squatters were one of the groups that started the Mau Mau rebellion?

elements.title: Caroline Harrison (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Caroline Harrison would mail ceramic milk sets to parents that named their children after U.S president Benjamin Harrison?

elements.title: pigs in blankets (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that pigs in blankets are not pigs in a blanket?
